description: Zeigt die Abacus Metrics fÃ¼r einen einzelnen Abacus-Server.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "system_info_cpu_used")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "value")

from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "system_info_process_kernel_time_total" or r["_measurement"] == "system_info_process_user_time_total")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_value"] != 0) 
  |> derivative(unit: 1m, nonNegative: true)
  |> group(columns: ["name", "pid"])
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value","name", "pid"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 1m, fn: sum, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "rate_user_time")

panels.description:
Total:  
Amount of physical memory.

Used:  
Amount of physical memory currently used.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "system_info_memory_total_bytes")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "system_info_memory_available_bytes")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.title: System - Memory

panels.description:
Total:  
The current size of the paging/swap file(s). If the paging/swap file can be extended, this is a soft limit.

Used:  
The current memory committed to the paging/swap file(s).

For more information see:  
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memory_paging#Implementations

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "system_info_swap_total_bytes")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "system_info_swap_used_bytes")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "used")

panels.title: System - Swap Size

panels.description:
In:  
Number of pages read from paging/swap file(s) to resolve hard page faults. (Hard page faults occur when a process requires code or data that is not in its working set or elsewhere in physical memory, and must be retrieved from disk.) This property was designed as a primary indicator of the kinds of faults that cause system-wide delays. It includes pages retrieved to satisfy faults in the file system cache (usually requested by applications) and in non-cached mapped memory files.

Out:  
Number of pages written to paging/swap file(s) to free up space in physical memory. Pages are written back to disk only if they are changed in physical memory, so they are likely to hold data, not code. A high rate of pages output might indicate a memory shortage. The operating system writes more pages back to disk to free up space when physical memory is in short supply.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "system_info_swap_pages_total")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["type"] == "In")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value"])
  |> derivative(unit: 1s, nonNegative: true)
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 45s, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "rate")

from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "system_info_swap_pages_total")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["type"] == "Out")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value"])
  |> derivative(unit: 1s, nonNegative: true)
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 45s, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "rate")

panels.title: System - Page Swap Rate [1min]

panels.description: The rate at which bytes are sent and received over each network adapter, including framing characters. Network Interface\Bytes Total/sec is a sum of Network Interface\Bytes Received/sec and Network Interface\Bytes Sent/sec.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "windows_default_pdh_network_interface_bytes_total_sec")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value", "item"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "windows_default_pdh_network_interface_bytes_received_sec")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value", "item"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "windows_default_pdh_network_interface_bytes_sent_sec")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value", "item"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.title: System - Network (Bytes/Second)

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "disk_total_bytes")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "disk_free_bytes")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "process_cpu_usage")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value","job"])
  |> group(columns: ["job"]) 
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.description: An approximation of the percent of CPU time used by GC activities over the last lookback period or since monitoring began, whichever is shorter.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "jvm_gc_overhead_percent")
  |> group(columns: ["job", "_field", "action"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.title: CPU - Garbage Collector

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "jvm_memory_used_bytes" or r["_measurement"] == "jvm_memory_max_bytes")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "value")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_value"] != 0) 
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["area"] == "heap")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["job"] == "${service}")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value", "_measurement", "job", "area"])
  |> group(columns: ["job", "area", "_measurement"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: sum, createEmpty: false)  // Aggregiert in Zeitfenstern
  |> yield(name: "sum")

panels.title: Abacus - Open Tables, Handel, Sessions und CTree.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "abacus_tables_count")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_value"] != 0) 
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value", "job", "type"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 1m, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.description:
The open handles count (eg: file handles).

On Windows platform this is GetProcessHandleCount (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/processthreadsapi/nf-processthreadsapi-getprocesshandlecount).

On Non-Windows this is determined via /proc/self/fd.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "process_files_open_files")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value", "job", "type"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 15s, fn: sum, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "sum_of_jvm_memory_used_bytes")

panels.title: Handles

targets.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "abacus_ulc_session_active")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value", "job"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "abacus_vaadin_ui_active")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value", "job"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "used")

from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "abacus_ctree_sessions" or r["_measurement"] == "abacus_ctree_sessions_max")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value", "_measurement"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "abacus_ctree_operations_total")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_value"] != 0) 
  |> derivative(unit: 1m, nonNegative: true)
  |> group(columns: ["op"])
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "_value","op"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 1m, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "rate_abacus_ctree_operations_total")

list.definition:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "disk_total_bytes")
  |> group(columns: ["instancename"])
  |> distinct(column: "instancename")
  |> keep(columns: ["_value"])
list.label: Instanz
list.name: instancename

query.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "disk_total_bytes")
  |> group(columns: ["instancename"])
  |> distinct(column: "instancename")
  |> keep(columns: ["_value"])

list.definition:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "jvm_memory_used_bytes")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["job"] != "AbaMetricsService" and r["job"] != "AbaMonitorService" and r["job"] != "AbaAuditServer")
  |> group(columns: ["job"])
  |> distinct(column: "job")
  |> keep(columns: ["_value"])
list.label: Service
list.name: service

query.query:
from(bucket: "${bucket}")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "jvm_memory_used_bytes")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["instancename"] == "${instancename}")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["job"] != "AbaMetricsService" and r["job"] != "AbaMonitorService" and r["job"] != "AbaAuditServer")
  |> group(columns: ["job"])
  |> distinct(column: "job")
  |> keep(columns: ["_value"])
